intro: Lachenalia undulata, commonly known as the undulating lachenalia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, tubular leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, bloom in late summer to early autumn. Lachenalia undulata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is well-suited for rock gardens and arid landscapes.
